document_title: Bradycardia: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_content:
Bradycardia is a condition in which the heart rate is less than 60 beats/minute at rest. Meanwhile, a normal person's heart rate is a sinus rhythm, which is controlled by the sinus node, which is the main pacemaker of the heart. A normal person's heart rate ranges from 60 - 100 beats/minute at rest. (first)
See more: What is arrhythmia?
